answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I was unable to find specific leadership scenarios but I have included some other resources that may offer a helpful start.
These two communities currently operate Leadership Academies. You may want to contact them individually for more information about their programs and possible scenarios.
 Mecklenburg County, NC
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14529/Leadership_Education_and_Development_Academy
Plano, TX
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5766/Management_Preparation_Program
This article discusses best practices for creating a leadership development program. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5517/Creating_a_Leadership_Development_Program
You can also read a similar article about the best methods of preparing next generation leaders.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4557/39_Best_Practices_for_Preparing_the_Next_Generation
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gregory Stopka
text:
I have a member in Texas that is looking for leadership scenarios to use for a leadership development academy.   A scenario is presented and then the the group discusses appropriate responses about what should be done? 
Does anyone use scenarios in their organizational development?
title: Leadership Scenarios
